intro: Macroscepis congestiflora, commonly known as the clustered macrocephalum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, clustered inflorescences with both ray and disc flowers, often in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
